page.title: 09ST. MARGARET'S, SUTTON
page.content:
{St.Margaret's Church} dates back {to 1313 along with the {Public House, The Plough.
This Church is just off the Woodbridge Road, along a private drive.
The former Head Boy of Woodbridge School( the independent school in Woodbridge ) in 1935 and member of Seckford House, is the{Vicar}of Shottisham and he is the incumbent of this parish too. It is situated in a grassy, well-mowed{churchyard}with grave stones big and small, scattered everywhere. It has colourful stain glass windows and flint walls, probably obtained from the surrounding area.
